content: tutorial 1 to begin row 1 make a slipknot and place the loop on your hook here s a video showing how to make a slipknot https //www youtube com/watch v=yglqoazenlu 2 now make your first chain to do this grab the yarn with your hook also called yarn over and pull it through the loop on your hook repeat until you have 135 chain loops not counting the loop on your hook 3 now yarn over and stick your hook into the third chain loop from the hook 3 4 yarn over and pull through the chain you will have three loops on the hook 5 yarn over again then pull the hook through all three loops on the hook you just completed a half_double_crochet stitch 6 now yarn over and stick your hook into the next chain to begin the next half_double_crochet stitch 4 7 yarn over and pull through the chain then yarn over again and pull through all three loops on the hook to complete your second half_double_crochet stitch 8 half_double_crochet into each chain until the end of the chains then flip your row over so the hook is on the right side 9 chain 2 to start the next row this counts as your first half_double_crochet stitch of the row 5 10 yarn over and stick your hook into the next stitch do not stick the hook into the stitch just below the chain- your chains count as the stitch for that one when you insert your hook you will be sliding it under the two loops that form the top of the stitch 11 yarn over again and pull through the stitch then yarn over again and pull through all three loops on the hook you finished your second half_double_crochet stitch 12 repeat steps 10 and 11 until you get to the end of the row then flip your work over and start the next row count your stitches every few row to be sure you still have 133 to change colors 1 in your last row in your first color complete the whole row but don t complete the last stitch yet yarn over and stick your hook into the last stitch then yarn over and pull through the stitch 6 2 yarn over with the new color then pull through all three loops on the hook to complete the half_double_crochet stitch then flip your work and continue as usual with the new color 3 cut the old color leaving a few inches as a tail use a yarn needle to hide the tails of yarn inside the stitches of your blanket this is called weaving in the ends still having trouble check out tamara kelly s video tutorials on her excellent crochet blog moogly she shows how to hold the yarn and hook how to make a slipknot how to make a chain and how to half double crochet http //www mooglyblog com/learn-how-to-crochet/ left handed check out this video http //www mooglyblog
